Term.definition: A data type representing true or false values in Kotlin and many other languages.
The definition of a function, including its name, parameters, and return type.
A four-sided shape with opposite sides equal, often used to describe a 2D grid or area in programming.
In the left-to-right direction, often referring to how elements are arranged or repeated in a row.
In the top-to-bottom direction, often referring to how elements are arranged or repeated in a column.
A Kotlin function used to mark code as not yet implemented; throws a NotImplementedError.
A loop construct that executes its body at least once before checking the condition.
A loop construct that repeats execution while a condition remains true.
A function that generates a random value, often used for unpredictability in programs.
A built-in Kotlin collection that stores ordered elements and allows access by index.
A data type representing a single character, such as a letter or digit.
The function's name, parameter types, and return type; defines how to call the function.
Kotlin function that reads a line of input from the user, returns null if input is unavailable.
The name, parameters, and return type of a function, without its implementation.
A value that points to an object or memory location, rather than containing the actual data.
The starting function where program execution begins, typically called main in Kotlin.
A text-based interface for user interaction with a program, often used for input and output.
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task and can be called by name.
A function in Kotlin that throws an exception, terminating program execution with an error message.
A function's name, parameters, and return type; defines how the function is called.
A function provided by the programming language, available for immediate use.
A feature in Kotlin that helps prevent null pointer exceptions by distinguishing nullable and non-nullable types.
A data type in Kotlin used to represent sequences of characters.
A text-based interface for user input and output in a program.
The width, in characters, of a single line in the pattern.
A function that adjusts a pattern row to a specified width, usually by adding spaces.
A variable representing the character(s) used to indicate a new line in text.
The entry point function in Kotlin where program execution starts.
Reads a line of input from the user or returns null if input is not available.
Kotlin function that concatenates elements of a collection into a single string with a separator.
A Kotlin function that throws a NotImplementedError, used as a placeholder for unfinished code.
A special value representing the absence of a value or object.
A Kotlin expression for conditional branching, similar to switch in other languages.
A data type representing true or false values, commonly used for conditions in programming.
A sequence of values with a defined start and end, often used in loops for iteration.
A text-based interface for user input and output, often used for debugging or interaction.
A value supplied to a function or method when it is called.
A naming convention where each word after the first starts with a capital letter, no spaces or underscores.
A program that interacts with users via text input and output in a command-line interface.
A program feature where the user and the application exchange messages in real time.
The function's name, parameters, and return type; describes how to call the function.
A named storage location in memory that holds a value which can change during program execution.
A way to embed variables or expressions inside string literals using the $ symbol in Kotlin.
A pattern already provided by the program, not entered by the user.
A pattern defined and entered by the user, not pre-existing in the program.
A surface or area where images or graphics can be drawn programmatically.
A variant of canvas generator that may introduce spaces or gaps in the pattern.
A special Kotlin type that indicates a function returns no meaningful value, similar to void in Java.
A runtime exception in Kotlin indicating that a method has been invoked at an illegal or inappropriate time.
Kotlin function that returns the smallest of the given values.
The process of restructuring existing code without changing its external behavior to improve readability or maintainability.
A way to embed variables or expressions inside a string using $ in Kotlin.
A combination of variables, values, and operators that produces a result.
A Kotlin function that prints a message to the standard output, followed by a newline.
A string used by trimMargin to identify and remove leading margin characters from each line.
A possible path of execution in a program, often used in conditional statements like if-else.
To add characters to a string to reach a desired length.
To divide a string into parts based on a delimiter.
A value automatically assigned to a function argument if no value is provided by the caller.
The result that a function provides back to the code that called it.
A Kotlin function that throws a NotImplementedError to mark code as not yet implemented.
Kotlin function that reads a line from standard input or returns null if input ends.
Used to signal an exception or error during program execution in Kotlin.
An ordered collection of elements, often used to represent data like characters in a string.
A single item within a collection, such as a list or array.
The function's name, parameters, and return type; defines how the function is called.
A classification that specifies which kind of value a variable can hold.
A whole number, positive or negative, without decimals.
A Kotlin control structure for branching logic, similar to switch-case in other languages.
A mutable object for efficiently building or modifying strings in Kotlin.
Kotlin's feature to prevent null pointer exceptions by handling nullable types explicitly.
A function without a name, often used for short, inline operations.
Represents the character(s) used to mark the end of a line in text.
Function that returns the width of a pattern, usually as the number of characters per row.
Function that returns the height of a pattern, usually as the number of rows.
Function that repeats a pattern horizontally a specified number of times in a string.
A named storage location in code that holds a value which can change during execution.
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task and can return a value.
A control structure that repeats a block of code while a condition is true.
A function's name, parameter types, and return type; defines how the function is called.
A function that returns elements matching a condition from a collection or string.
An ordered collection of elements that can be accessed by their index.
Kotlin's conditional expression, similar to switch in other languages, for branching logic based on value.
A loop that executes its block at least once before checking its condition.
A data type representing true or false values.
Anonymous functions that can be used as values or passed as arguments to functions.
An ordered collection of elements, allowing duplicates and accessed by index.
The definition of a function, including its name, parameters, and return type.
A value passed to a function when it is called.
Unpredictable value or selection, often generated by a computer using algorithms.
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task and can return a value.
Values passed to a function when it is called, used as input parameters.
Specifies the value or result that a function provides after execution.
Kotlin operator (?.) that executes an action only if the object is not null.
A Kotlin function that executes a block of code within the context of an object.
Situations that occur at the extreme ends or boundaries of input or operation.
A symbol or keyword that performs an operation on one or more operands.
Alternative code paths in control flow statements like if or when.
A function's name, parameters, and return type; defines how the function is called.
An anonymous function that can be passed as an argument or assigned to a variable.
Kotlin function that returns an iterable of index-value pairs from a collection.
A collection of source code files and resources organized to build a software application.
A specific piece of work or assignment to be completed as part of a project.
Official written descriptions and explanations of a programming language, library, or tool.
A combination of variables, values, and operators that produces a result.
A section of code executed depending on a condition, such as 'if' or 'else' parts.
A character or string used to divide elements when joining them into a single string.
The function's name, parameter types, and return type; defines how to call the function.
A mutable sequence of characters used to efficiently build or modify strings in Kotlin.
The definition of a function's name, parameters, and return type.
Values passed to a function when it is called.
Integrated Development Environment, a software application for writing, running, and debugging code.
A collection function that returns elements matching a given condition.
A data type representing a single 16-bit Unicode character in Kotlin.
A character or string used to separate elements, such as spaces between letters in a displayed word.
A function's name, parameters, and return type; describes how to call the function.
A special Kotlin function that marks code as not yet implemented and throws a NotImplementedError.
A value passed to a function when it is called.
Used to signal an exception or error during program execution in Kotlin.
A type that can hold either a value or null, indicated by a question mark (?).
A Kotlin operator (?:) that provides a default value if an expression is null.
Kotlin function that joins elements of a collection into a single string with a separator.
Kotlin collection type representing an ordered group of elements, accessible by index.
To write and develop the code needed to create a specific functionality or program.
